claims.claim: Self-employment can be a viable option for individuals with criminal records.
claims.quote: Because I have degrees in various areas, I created a job for myself.

claims.claim: Resource directories developed by ex-offenders are crucial for providing returning citizens with accessible information on recovery services.
claims.quote: And it was developed by ex-offenders. And we developed that directory so that when men and women came out of prison...everything that they need to know, every resource that they need to have access to is in that directory.

claims.claim: In-prison access to reentry resources helps prepare currently incarcerated individuals for their eventual return to society.
claims.quote: So that means they have access now to the resources that are available for those that are coming home and even for those that remaining under those conditions of incarceration.

claims.claim: Resource directories should cover a wide range of services, including jobs, healthcare, drug and mental health treatment.
claims.quote: I can find housing here. I can find jobs here. I can find healthcare here. I can find I need drug treatment. I can find that here. I need mental health treatment. I can find that here.

claims.claim: Incarcerated individuals serving long or life sentences can still contribute positively by aiding others in accessing reentry resources.
claims.quote: It connects that one that's still going to be there with life plus 50, 60 years, or four or five natural life sentences and things of this nature. That person can help others while they're incarcerated.
